segments.en: Hello, English learners.
Welcome to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
And I'm Erika.
And today we have a very special guest in our studio, Dainee.
segments.cn: 今天我们有一位特别的嘉宾，Dainee。

segments.en: Hi, everyone.
I'm Dainee.
Dainee is part of our EnglishPod team, and today she's going to help us with this Chinese New Year's lesson.
segments.cn: Dainee是我们EnglishPod团队的一员，今天她将帮助我们进行这个关于中国新年的课程。

segments.en: It's an intermediate lesson, but it has a lot of cultural aspects about Chinese New Year.
segments.cn: 这是一个中级课程，但有很多关于中国新年的文化内容。

segments.en: So that's what Dainee is going to help us out with today.
Yes, today we're going to learn a little bit about Chinese New Year in English.
segments.cn: 是的，今天我们将用英语学习一些关于中国新年的知识。

segments.en: And we're also going to learn some language for describing things that we're excited about.
segments.cn: 我们还将学习一些描述我们兴奋事物的语言。

segments.en: Okay, yeah, I'm excited to hear the show.
segments.cn: 好的，我很期待听这个节目。

segments.en: Okay, so let's listen to the dialogue now.
And then when we come back, we'll explain everything.
segments.cn: 然后回来时我们会解释一切。

segments.en: I'm so excited about Chinese New Year.
segments.cn: 我对中国新年感到非常兴奋。

segments.en: When do I get to visit Grandma?
segments.cn: 我什么时候能去看奶奶？

segments.en: Grandma makes the best dumplings in the world.
segments.cn: 奶奶做的饺子是世界上最好吃的。

segments.en: Ha ha, right.
Sounds to me like you're more excited about dumplings than seeing your grandma.
segments.cn: 听起来你更期待饺子而不是见奶奶。

segments.en: Of course I miss Grandma too.
I bet she's going to teach me how to play mahjong.
segments.cn: 我敢打赌她会教我打麻将。

segments.en: Hey, Dad, are you going to buy me firecrackers this year?
segments.cn: 嘿，爸爸，今年你会给我买鞭炮吗？

segments.en: We're going to have the best fireworks.
I'm really looking forward to lighting them.
segments.cn: 我真的很期待点燃它们。

segments.en: Son, firecrackers aren't toys.
They are dangerous.
No, fireworks are awesome.
Wow, don't you remember?
Last year when I set up the firecrackers, you covered both your ears and hid behind your mother.
segments.cn: 去年我放鞭炮时，你捂住耳朵躲在你妈妈身后。

segments.en: Dad, I was scared because I saw a bug, that's all.
segments.cn: 爸爸，我是因为看到虫子才害怕的，仅此而已。

segments.en: Ha ha, really?
Oh, and I can't wait to watch the dragon dance.
segments.cn: 哦，我迫不及待想看舞龙。

segments.en: Dad, can I sit on your shoulders this time?
segments.cn: 爸爸，这次我可以坐在你肩膀上吗？

segments.en: Hey, I offered last year.
Well, anyways, I was just thinking of the red envelopes.
segments.cn: 好吧，我只是想到了红包。

segments.en: I want to make a list of all the things I'm going to buy with my red envelope money.
segments.cn: 我想列出我用红包钱要买的所有东西。

segments.en: I can't wait.
I'm going to have so much money.
Mom, can I get a pen and a piece of paper?
segments.cn: 妈妈，我可以要一支笔和一张纸吗？

segments.en: I want a new transformer.
segments.cn: 我想要一个新的变形金刚。

segments.en: No, two transformers.
I want a surprise.
Wheeljack.
I'll get a PSP game.
Okay,
so Chinese New Year.
A lot of exciting vocabulary here.
segments.cn: 这里有很多令人兴奋的词汇。

segments.en: Before we get into describing it, let's look at the vocabulary that we saw in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 在我们描述之前，先看看我们在语言要点中看到的词汇。

segments.en: Language Takeaway.
The first word on Language Takeaway, dumplings.
segments.cn: 语言要点中的第一个词，饺子。

segments.en: Dumplings.
Dumplings.
Well, in Chinese, we call it shui jiao.
segments.cn: 在中文中，我们称之为水饺。

segments.en: And it's a very traditional Chinese food, and it's getting very famous now.
segments.cn: 这是一种非常传统的中国食物，现在越来越有名。

segments.en: Yes, so it's basically small pieces of dough with maybe some meat or some vegetables inside.
segments.cn: 是的，基本上是小块面团，里面可能有一些肉或蔬菜。

segments.en: And then they are boiled.
Usually in a soup.
In a soup.
But you can also have fried dumplings.
Yeah, that's right.
Which are really good.
So if you know Italian food, they're really similar to a tortellini.
segments.cn: 所以如果你知道意大利食物，它们和意大利饺子非常相似。

segments.en: Exactly.
Or in Latin America, it's very similar to maybe an empanada.
segments.cn: 或者在拉丁美洲，它们和饺子也很相似。

segments.en: It's like a small little empanada.
Marco, what's our next word?
Alright, our next word, firecrackers.
Firecrackers.
Firecrackers.
Firecrackers.
This is a firecracker.
Firecrackers are so common in China.
We use it all the time on all occasions.
segments.cn: 我们在所有场合都使用它。

segments.en: And especially on the New Year's Eve, traditionally people use it to scare off the evil.
segments.cn: 特别是在除夕，传统上人们用它来驱赶邪灵。

segments.en: Evil spirits.
The evil spirits.
Okay.
So on Chinese New Year, there are millions of firecrackers.
segments.cn: 所以在中国新年，有数百万的鞭炮。

segments.en: Millions of firecrackers.
Now, there are also a lot of fireworks.
Fireworks.
Fireworks.
Fireworks.
So fireworks are similar to firecrackers.
But they have lots of light.
They go up in the air and explode and you see lots of nice colors.
segments.cn: 它们升上天空爆炸，看到很多美丽的颜色。

segments.en: Beautiful colors, yep.
Very popular in 4th of July in the United States.
segments.cn: 在美国的独立日非常受欢迎。

segments.en: Or New Year's Eve.
New Year's Eve.
Fireworks.
Okay, now let's look at our last word.
segments.cn: 好的，现在让我们看看最后一个词。

segments.en: Set off.
Set off.
Set off.
Set off.
So this is the verb you would use with firecrackers.
segments.cn: 这是你用来形容鞭炮的动词。

segments.en: Yeah, it means like explode the firecracker.
segments.cn: 是的，它的意思是引爆鞭炮。

segments.en: Right.
Set off the firecracker.
Set off the bomb.
Set off fireworks.
Well, let's listen to our dialogue a second time.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们再听一遍对话。

segments.en: And this time it'll be a little bit slower so that you can understand the language a bit better.
segments.cn: 这次会慢一点，以便你能更好地理解语言。

segments.en: I'm so excited about Chinese New Year.
segments.cn: 我对春节感到非常兴奋。

segments.en: When do I get to visit grandma?
segments.cn: 我什么时候能去看奶奶？

segments.en: Grandma makes the best dumplings in the world.

segments.en: Haha, right.
Sounds to me like you are more excited about dumplings than seeing your grandma.
segments.cn: 听起来你更兴奋的是饺子，而不是见奶奶。

segments.en: Of course I miss grandma too.
I bet she's going to teach me how to play mahjong.
segments.cn: 我敢打赌她会教我打麻将。

segments.en: Hey, dad, are you going to buy me firecrackers this year?
segments.cn: 嘿，爸爸，你今年会给我买鞭炮吗？

segments.en: We're going to have the best fireworks.
I'm really looking forward to lighting them.
segments.cn: 我真的很期待点燃它们。

segments.en: Son, firecrackers aren't toys.
They're dangerous.
No, fireworks are awesome.
Whoa, don't you remember?
Last year when I set off the firecrackers, you covered both your ears and hid behind your mother.
segments.cn: 去年我放鞭炮时，你捂住耳朵躲在你妈妈身后。

segments.en: Dad, I was scared because I saw a bug, that's all.
segments.cn: 爸爸，我是因为看到虫子才害怕的，仅此而已。

segments.en: Haha, really?
Oh, and I can't wait to watch the dragon dance.
segments.cn: 哦，我迫不及待想看舞龙。

segments.en: Dad, can I sit on your shoulders this time?
segments.cn: 爸爸，这次我可以坐在你肩膀上吗？

segments.en: Hey, I offered last year.
Well, I... anyways, I was just thinking of the red envelopes.
segments.cn: 好吧，我... 不管怎样，我只是想着红包。

segments.en: I want to make a list of all the things I'm going to buy with my red envelope money.
segments.cn: 我想列出我用红包钱要买的所有东西。

segments.en: I can't wait.
I'm going to have so much money.
Mom, can I get a pen and a piece of paper?
segments.cn: 妈妈，我可以要一支笔和一张纸吗？

segments.en: I want a new transformer.
segments.cn: 我想要一个新的变形金刚。

segments.en: No, two transformers.
The Optimus Prime and maybe the Wheeljack.
segments.cn: 一个擎天柱，也许还有一个威震天。

segments.en: I'll get a PSP game.
Haha, and I'll buy the entire class lunch at McDonald's.
segments.cn: 哈哈，我会请全班在麦当劳吃午餐。

segments.en: Okay, so we saw some really great phrases of describing excitement, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，我们看到了一些描述兴奋的很棒的短语，对吧？

segments.en: So let's start with fluency builder.
segments.cn: 所以让我们开始流利度训练。

segments.en: Fluency builder.
We have four phrases for you today.
segments.cn: 今天我们有四个短语给你。

segments.en: And the first one is, I'm so excited about.
segments.cn: 第一个是，我对...感到非常兴奋。

segments.en: I'm so excited about.
I'm so excited about.
So when you say, I'm so excited, it means that you are... Like really happy.
segments.cn: 所以当你说，我很兴奋时，意味着你... 非常开心。

segments.en: That something is going to happen.
Yeah, so happy you can't relax.
Right, so you could say, I'm so excited about our vacation next month.
segments.cn: 对，所以你可以说，我对下个月的假期感到非常兴奋。

segments.en: I'm so excited about opening all my presents.
segments.cn: 我对打开所有礼物感到非常兴奋。

segments.en: Exactly, so excited.
Now we also saw another really great word, very similar to I'm so excited.
segments.cn: 现在我们还看到另一个很棒的词，和我很兴奋非常相似。

segments.en: Yeah.
I'm really looking forward to.
I'm really looking forward to.
I'm really looking forward to.
I'm really looking forward to.
So this is a little bit less than excited, right?
segments.cn: 所以这比兴奋稍微少一点，对吧？

segments.en: A bit less strong.
Right.
So you would say, Oh, I'm really looking forward to meeting your new girlfriend.
segments.cn: 所以你可以说，哦，我非常期待见到你的新女朋友。

segments.en: Or you can say, I'm really looking forward to seeing that movie.
segments.cn: 或者你可以说，我非常期待看那部电影。

segments.en: Exactly.
So it means you're a little bit excited, but not so excited.
segments.cn: 所以这意味着你有一点兴奋，但不是那么兴奋。

segments.en: Yeah, you're happy about something that's going to happen in the future.
segments.cn: 是的，你对未来要发生的事情感到开心。

segments.en: Now let's look at our next phrase.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看下一个短语。

segments.en: And it's very similar to excited.
I can't wait.
I can't wait.
I can't wait.
I can't wait.
So this is very, very similar to I'm so excited.
segments.cn: 所以这和我很兴奋非常相似。

segments.en: Yes.
When you're so excited for something, you can't wait for it.
segments.cn: 当你对某事非常兴奋时，你等不及要去做。

segments.en: Let's listen to some more examples of I can't.
segments.cn: 让我们听一些关于我等不及的例子。

segments.en: wait.
Example three.
I can't wait to open my presents.
segments.cn: 我等不及要打开我的礼物。

segments.en: So we can use it again the same way.
segments.cn: 所以我们可以以同样的方式再次使用它。

segments.en: I can't wait to go on vacation next month.
segments.cn: 我等不及要下个月去度假。

segments.en: I can't wait to open all my presents.
segments.cn: 我等不及要打开所有的礼物。

segments.en: Exactly.
Now our last phrase.
segments.cn: 现在我们的最后一个短语。

segments.en: I bet.
I bet.
I bet.
I bet.
B-E-T.
Bet.
Bet.
So when you say I bet, it means that you're pretty sure about something.
segments.cn: 所以当你说我敢打赌时，意味着你对某事很确定。

segments.en: You predict it will happen.
Right.
So let's listen to some more examples of I bet.
segments.cn: 所以让我们听一些关于我敢打赌的例子。

segments.en: Example one.
I bet I'm going to get so much money for Chinese New Year.
segments.cn: 我敢打赌我会在春节得到很多钱。

segments.en: Example two.
Robert's late.
Where do you think he is?
I bet he's stuck in traffic.
segments.cn: 我敢打赌他被堵在交通里。

segments.en: Example three.
I bet the boss is going to give us a big bonus this year.
segments.cn: 我敢打赌老板今年会给我们一个大奖金。

segments.en: Well, I guess we're ready to listen to our dialogue for the third time.
segments.cn: 好吧，我想我们准备好第三次听我们的对话了。

segments.en: And then when we come back, Danny's going to tell us all about Chinese New Year.
segments.cn: 然后当我们回来时，丹尼会告诉我们关于中国新年的一切。

segments.en: I'm so excited about Chinese New Year.
segments.cn: 我对中国新年感到非常兴奋。

segments.en: Grandma makes the best dumplings in the world.

segments.en: Haha.
Right.
Sounds to me like you're more excited about dumplings than seeing your grandma.
segments.cn: 听起来你对饺子比见奶奶更兴奋。

I'm really looking forward to lighting them.

Wow.

segments.en: That's all.
Haha.
Really?

segments.en: Hey, I offered last year.
Well, I... anyways, I was just thinking of the red envelopes.

segments.en: I want to make a list of all the things I'm going to buy with my red envelope money.

I'm going to have so much money.
Mom, can I get a pen and a piece of paper?

segments.cn: 我想要一个新的变形金刚。

segments.en: No, two transformers.
Apples pride.
Wheeljack.
I'll get a PSP game.
So, Dainee, what are these red packets of money about?
segments.cn: 所以，达妮，你说这些红包是怎么回事？

segments.en: So, in Chinese, we call it Hong bao.
segments.cn: 在中文中，我们称之为红包。

segments.en: And it's basically a bag full of money.
segments.cn: 基本上是装满钱的袋子。

segments.en: Why do you get money?
As a gift.
As a gift?
Wow.
The children get it, though.
Only children get it.
If you're a university student and you haven't got a job yet, then you can still ask for Hong bao from your parents or your relatives.
segments.cn: 如果你是大学生还没有工作，那么你仍然可以向父母或亲戚要红包。

segments.en: So, is there some meaning to this gift of money?
segments.cn: 那么，这个钱的礼物有什么意义吗？

segments.en: Well, it is believed that children have to put these red envelopes under their pillow on New Year's Eve to scare away the evil spirits.
segments.cn: 嗯，人们相信孩子们必须在除夕夜把这些红包放在枕头下，以驱赶邪灵。

segments.en: Again, like the firecrackers.
A lot of evil spirits in China.
So, Dainee, how much money would a kid get for Chinese New Year?
segments.cn: 所以，达妮，孩子们在中国新年能得到多少钱？

segments.en: Well, when I was little, the best year I got was 3,000 RMB.
segments.cn: 嗯，我小时候，最好的年份我得到了3000元人民币。

segments.en: Which is like almost... Five hundred dollars.
Wow.
I was so rich at the time.
Wow, amazing.
What about this game, mahjong?
Mahjong?
Mahjong.
Have you played it?
No.
No.
Again, it's a very traditional Chinese game.
segments.cn: 再说，这是一种非常传统的中国游戏。

segments.en: And you will see senior people always gathering along the table.
segments.cn: 你会看到老年人总是聚在桌子旁。

segments.en: So, old people.
Old people.
So, it's like a board game, kind of like chess?
segments.cn: 所以，这像棋盘游戏，像象棋吗？

segments.en: It's kind of like chess, but they have specially made chess.
segments.cn: 有点像象棋，但他们有特别制作的棋子。

segments.en: It's very different.
Okay.
So, I want to know more about the fireworks and firecrackers on Chinese New Year.
segments.cn: 所以，我想了解更多关于中国新年的烟花和鞭炮。

segments.en: Okay, usually we buy firecrackers.
I believe fireworks are more expensive.
So, we play firecrackers, pao Jiang.
And usually we do it right after midnight.
segments.cn: 通常我们在午夜后立即放。

segments.en: So, 12 o'clock.
And it's very loud.
And say for example, I personally don't even dare to stay close when they set off the firecrackers.
segments.cn: 比如说，我个人甚至不敢靠近他们放鞭炮。

segments.en: Because it's just way too loud.
And everyone starts to like them.
segments.cn: 每个人都开始喜欢它们。

segments.en: No, it's amazing.
It's pretty.
I've seen Chinese New Year three times in China.
segments.cn: 我在中国见过三次中国新年。

segments.en: And each time I've just been amazed.
It's so cool and so noisy and so awesome.
I mean, you've got to visit China to see this.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，你必须去中国看看。

segments.en: Yeah, it's a really cool festival.
segments.cn: 是的，这是一个非常酷的节日。

segments.en: And definitely playing with firecrackers is always fun.
segments.cn: 而且玩鞭炮总是很有趣。

segments.en: Yeah, maybe a little bit dangerous.
Well, everyone, we've just learned about how New Year's is celebrated in China.
segments.cn: 好吧，大家，我们刚刚了解了中国的新年庆祝活动。

segments.en: And we want to know, how do you celebrate New Year's in your country?
segments.cn: 我们想知道，你们在自己的国家是如何庆祝新年的？

segments.en: Exactly.
How do you welcome the New Year?
segments.cn: 你们是如何迎接新年的？

segments.en: How do you scare away evil spirits?
segments.cn: 你们是如何驱赶邪灵的？

segments.en: Right?
So come to our website at EnglishPod.com and leave us your comments.
segments.cn: 所以请访问我们的网站 EnglishPod.com 并留下你的评论。

segments.en: That's right.
Dainee, Erika and I will be there to answer all your questions.
segments.cn: Dainee、Erika 和我会在那儿回答你们所有的问题。

segments.en: So be sure to send us some comments.
segments.cn: 所以一定要给我们留言。

segments.en: Well, everyone, thanks for listening.
segments.cn: 好吧，大家，谢谢你们的收听。

segments.en: And until next time, bye.
